Package sources

Class Receiver

java.lang.Object
sources.Receiver
public class Receiver extends Object
Receiver class contains the methods that perform the requested commands and manipulate the movie collection.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Receiver(Invoker invoker, String path)
    Receiver constructor initializes the movieCollection and path variables.

  • Constructor Details

    • Receiver

      public Receiver(Invoker invoker, String path) throws InvalidFileDataException
      Receiver constructor initializes the movieCollection and path variables.
      Parameters:
      invoker - the Invoker instance to be used
      path - the file path to read the movie collection from
      Throws:
      InvalidFileDataException - if the file data is invalid

  • Method Details

    • help

      public void help()
      Prints a list of available commands to the console.

    • info

      public void info()
      Prints information about the MovieCollection to the console.

    • show

      public void show()
      Prints all the movies in the MovieCollection to the console.

    • insert

      public void insert(String key)
      Inserts a new Movie object into the MovieCollection with a given key.
      Parameters:
      key - the key for the new Movie object.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the key already used in the MovieCollection.

    • update

      public void update(String key)
      Updates the value of a Movie object in the MovieCollection with a given key.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of the Movie object to be updated.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the key does not exist in the MovieCollection.

    • removeKey

      public void removeKey(String key)
      Removes an element from the MovieCollection by key.
      Parameters:
      key - a string representation of the integer key of the element to remove
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the key does not exist in the collection

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the MovieCollection.

    • save

      public void save()
      Saves the MovieCollection to an XML file.

    • executeScript

      public void executeScript(String path)
      Executes commands from a script file.
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the script file

    • exit

      public void exit()
      Sets the exit flag to true.

    • removeGreater

      public void removeGreater()
      Removes all elements from the MovieCollection greater than the entered element.

    • replaceIfLowe

      public void replaceIfLowe(String key)
      Replaces an element in the MovieCollection if its value is lower than the specified element.
      Parameters:
      key - a string representation of the integer key of the element to replace
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the key does not exist in the collection

    • removeLowerKey

      public void removeLowerKey(String key)
      Removes all elements from the MovieCollection with keys lower than the specified key.
      Parameters:
      key - a string representation of the integer key to compare

    • printAscending

      public void printAscending()
      Prints the elements of the MovieCollection in ascending order.

    • printDescending

      public void printDescending()
      Prints the elements of the MovieCollection in descending order

    • printFieldDescendingOscarsCount

      public void printFieldDescendingOscarsCount()
      Prints the elements of the MovieCollection sorted in descending order by their Oscars count

    • canExit

      public boolean canExit()
      Checks if the exit flag has been set. If the flag has been set, it returns true, indicating that the program can exit. Otherwise, it returns false.
      Returns:
      true if the exit flag has been set, false otherwise
